trans-unit.source: Represents an individual row in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> class is used represent an individual row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
Each row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control has a designated row type using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType> enumeration.
The following table lists the different row types.
Row type
Description
A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The empty row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

The empty row is displayed when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control has no records to display and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.EmptyDataTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> template is not `null`.
The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
A separator row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
To determine the row type of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object also has a state associated with it.
The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.
State value
Description
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in edit mode.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is selected.
To determine the state of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowState%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control stores all of its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection.

To determine the index of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex%2A> property.

You can access the properties of the underlying data object that is bound to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property is available only during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
To determine the index of the data object in the underlying data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex%2A> property.
You can access the individual cells of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property.
If a cell contains other controls, you can retrieve a control from the cell by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the cell.
You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the cell to find the control, if the control has an <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> specified.

To retrieve a field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> field column or an automatically generated field column, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property of the cell.

To retrieve a field value from other field column types where the field value is bound to a control, first retrieve the control from the appropriate cell and then access the appropriate property of the control.
It is possible to use a data-binding expression directly in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField> field column without binding the value to a property of a control.
In this case, the field value is automatically placed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control.

To retrieve the field value, you must first retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control from the appropriate cell and then use its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow>.
Property
Initial Value
The value of the `dataItemIndex` parameter.
The value of the `rowIndex` parameter.
The value of the `rowState` parameter.
The value of the `rowType` parameter.

The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows"></xref> collection of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem"></xref> in the underlying <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> enumeration values.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets the underlying data object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object is bound.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property to access the properties of the underlying data object to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is bound.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property is only available during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
This property applies only to data rows.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the underlying data object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object is bound.
Gets the index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem"></xref> in the underlying <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex%2A> property to determine the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> in the underlying <xref:System.Data.DataSet>.
This property applies only to data rows.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem"></xref> in the underlying data source.
Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.
The source of the event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
`true` if the event has been canceled; otherwise, `false`.

Gets the index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows"></xref> collection of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex%2A> property to determine the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
This property applies only to data rows.

The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows"></xref> collection of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
Gets the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property to determine the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object.
The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table:
Status value
Description
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in edit mode.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is selected.
This property is commonly used to determine the state of a row before performing an operation.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> values.
Gets the row type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property to determine the type of row that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object represents.
The following table lists the different row type values using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType> enumeration.
Row type
Description
A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The empty row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The empty row is displayed when <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control does not have any records to display.
A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
A separator row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
This property is commonly used to determine a row's type before performing an operation.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> values.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DataItem"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.
Returns <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DataItemIndex"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.
Returns <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DisplayIndex"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.
Returns <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex"></xref>.
